title: Queen's Speech 2019: Monarch says Britain will leave on Oct 31 - plus all the other key points
text:
Britain's priority is to leave the European Union at the end of this month, the Queen said today.

Setting out the Government's legislative plan, despite the fact that might be curtailed by an early general election, the Queen set out six Brexit-related Bills.

She said: "My Government's priority has always been to secure the United Kingdom's departure from the European Union on October 31.

"My Government intends to work towards a new partnership with the European Union, based on free trade and friendly co-operation."

The comments are significant hardening on the Queen's Speech in 2017 when the Queen said that her Government's priority was to get a deal, rather than leave without one.
